The History of Eriol or Ælfwine and the End of the Tales

wikitext.*:
'''Taruithorn''' was a town in [[Tol Eressëa]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. It later became known as '''[[Oxford]]'''.<ref name="Oxf">{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''13''', p. 292</ref>

After the [[Faring Forth]], and the removal of Tol Eressëa to the [[Great Lands]], it was conquered by [[Horsa]], one of the sons of [[Eriol]], the [[Men|Mannish]] mariner who visited the Lonely Isle years prior.<ref>{{LT2|VI}}, p. 293</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Taruithorn'' is in [[Gnomish]]. It consists of the elements ''[[tarog]]'' ("ox") + ''[[tarn]]'' ("gate"). Its [[Qenya]] cognate is '''''Taruktarna'''''.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2806508727.html|articlename=G. ''Taruithorn'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=23 April 2022}}</ref>

Some of its earlier, rejected names are ''Taruitharn'' and ''Taruithron''.<ref>{{PE|11}}, p. 69</ref>

The town was called '''''Oxenaford''''' in [[Old English]].<ref name="Oxf"/>
